polimi.reds.broker.routing
Interface SubscriptionTable

All Known Implementing Classes:
GenericTable
public interface SubscriptionTable

A SubscriptionTable is used by the REDS broker to store information about the subscriptions (i.e., filters) it received from its neighbors. This is the generic interface, classes implementing this interface may differ for the strategy adopted to store subscriptions and, most important for the performances of the match method, which mainly influences the broker's performances.

Method Detail

addSubscription

void addSubscription(NodeDescriptor n,
                     Filter f)
Adds the given subscription to the table.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor who subscribed.
f - The filter that describes the interests of the neighbor.

removeSubscription

void removeSubscription(NodeDescriptor n,
                        Filter f)
Removes the given subscription to the table.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor who unsubscribed.
f - The filter to remove.

removeAllSubscriptions

void removeAllSubscriptions(NodeDescriptor n)
Removes all the filters associated to the given neighbor. Usually called when a neighbor leaves.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor who unsubscribed.

clear

void clear()
Clears the entire table.

isSubscribed

boolean isSubscribed(NodeDescriptor n)
Returns true if the given neighbor has at least one subscription.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor to test.
Returns:
true if the given neighbor has at least one subscription, false if it never subscribed.

isSubscribed

boolean isSubscribed(NodeDescriptor n,
                     Filter f)
Returns true if the given neighbor is subscribed to the given filter.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor to test.
f - The filter to test.
Returns:
true if the given neighbor is subscribed to the given filter, false otherwise.

isFilterInTable

boolean isFilterInTable(Filter filter)
Returns true if at least one neighbor subscribed with the given filter.

Parameters:
filter - The filter to test.
Returns:
true if the given filter appears into the table.

getSingleSubscribedBroker

NodeDescriptor getSingleSubscribedBroker(Filter filter)
If just a single neighbor and in particular a broker subscribed with the given filter this method returns it, otherwise it returns null.

Parameters:
filter - The filter to test.
Returns:
The single broker subscribed with the given filter, or null if more than one neighbor subscribed with the given filter or if a client subscribed with the given filter.

getAllFilters

java.util.Collection getAllFilters(NodeDescriptor n)
Returns the collection of filters associated to the given neighbor into the table.
If there are no filters associated to the neighbor, the returned collection is empty, but not null.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
n - The neighbor whose subscriptions must be taken.
Returns:
The collection of filters associated to the given neighbor into the table.

getAllFilters

java.util.Collection getAllFilters(boolean duplicate)
Returns the collection of all filters included in this table (i.e., independently from the neighbors they are associated to). Duplicates are kept or removed depending on the value of the duplicate parameter.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
duplicate - If true accept duplicates, otherwise eliminate them.
Returns:
The collection of all filters included in this table.

getAllFiltersExcept

java.util.Collection getAllFiltersExcept(boolean duplicate,
                                         NodeDescriptor n)
Returns the collection of all filters included in this table (i.e., independently from the neighbors they are associated to) not considering the given neighbor. Duplicates are kept or removed depending on the value of the duplicate parameter.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
duplicate - If true accept duplicates, otherwise eliminate them.
n - The neighbor whose filters must be excluded.
Returns:
The collection of all filters included in this table.

matches

java.util.Collection matches(Message message)
Returns the collection of all neighbors that have at least one filter that matches the given message.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
message - The message to match.
Returns:
The collection of all neighbors that have at least one filter that matches the given message.

matches

java.util.Collection matches(Message message,
                             NodeDescriptor excludedDestination)
Returns the collection of all neighbors that have at least one filter that matches the given message. It ignores the neighbor whose ID is passed as parameter.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
message - The message to match.
excludedDestination - the ID of the neighbor that is excluded from matching.
Returns:
The collection of all neighbors that have at least one filter that matches the given message.

getSubscribedNeighbors

java.util.Collection getSubscribedNeighbors(Filter f)
Returns the collection of all neighbors that subscribed to the given filter.

Every call to this method returns a new collection object, so that it can be used without problems even if the subscription table is modified concurrently.

Parameters:
f - The filter to search for.
Returns:
The collection of all neighbors that subscribed to the given filter.
